page.title: 03FARMING: I
page.content: {Abbots Court Farm}was taken over by the Houlbrookes in 1957. The farm was halved in 1958 with their son-in-law and daughter who lived next door. At that time 29 cows were milked until 1963 when disease 'abortion' broke out and the herd had to be destroyed. In 197O Mr. Samuel took over the whole farm. At the present time the farm of 217 acres consists of arable, beef and dairy cattle.{Apperley Court}keeps mainly{Simmental cattle}for breeding purposes. Part of a vogue for experimenting with imported cattle,these Swiss cattle are sired by their own bull. They are shown at County shows, the nearest being the 'Three Counties' at Malvern. The cattle are fed on minerals and cake and in summer are put out to graze.
